info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 13 at 3:38PM HST until November 14 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY FOR PORTIONS OF MAUI AND HAWAII COUNTIES THROUGH TUESDAY... .Strong northeast trade winds are expected to become especially gusty tonight as a cold front moves through the island chain. Strong winds will continue through Tuesday. ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...East winds 20 to 35 mph with localized gusts over 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Kahoolawe, Lanai, Maui, Molokai and the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can tear off shingles, knock down tree branches, blow away tents and awnings and make it difficult to steer, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Watch out for falling tree branches when walking or driving. Make sure tents and awnings are secure or take them down. Be prepared for power outages.
